content: I have been diagnosised with diabetes type II with neuropathy from agent orange. what percent disability does the VA usually give for this.

content: You need to talk to the VA, if you have a service related condition. You need to talk to the VA! This message has been edited. Last edited by: Bergy46, Fri 01 May 2009 07:36 PM Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: Also, unfortunately, each state awards different levels to individuals dependent upon their disability and level of same. As Bergy stated, visit your local VA or call them at 1-800-827-1000. If you can make it through the computer voice you'll finally end up with a person. Good Luck!!
reply: Also, unfortunately, each state awards different levels to individuals dependent upon their disability and level of same. As Bergy stated, visit your local VA or call them at 1-800-827-1000. If you can make it through the computer voice you'll finally end up with a person. Good Luck!!

content: va.gov Contact a VSO and get the ball rolling. Depends on the severity. I also suffer from Diabetes II. Nueropathy is a serious problem. I've lost my feet and it's working on my left hand and bowel. Get treatment ASAP! Remember, there is no cure for it! Got money for everything but "VETERANS" Same old story!
